vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.12.3
§ Berachah = "blessing"
n pr m
1) a Benjamite, one of David's warriors
n pr loc
2) a valley in the wilderness near Tekoa where Jehoshaphat and his people assembled to bless Jehovah after the overthrow of the hosts of the Moabites
vocabinfos._es_Definition: guerrero; tribu de Benjamín; en tiempos del rey David
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
陽性專有名詞
比拉迦 这个字在原文的意思是 "祝福"
1) 一位便雅憫人, 是大衛的大能勇士之一 (代上12:3)
專有名詞 地名
2) 靠近提哥亞的曠野中的一個村落, 約沙法和其百姓曾聚在此為入侵的摩押
人被擊殺潰敗而讚美神 (代下20:26)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
阳性专有名词
比拉迦 这个字在原文的意思是 "祝福"
1) 一位便雅悯人, 是大卫的大能勇士之一 (代上12:3)
专有名词 地名
2) 靠近提哥亚的旷野中的一个村落, 约沙法和其百姓曾聚在此为入侵的摩押
人被击杀溃败而赞美神 (代下20:26)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
Combined with e.meq (עֵ֫מֶק " Valley" H6010H)
§ Berachah = "blessing"
n pr m
This name is used for:
1) a Benjamite, one of David's warriors
n pr loc
2) a valley in the wilderness near Tekoa where Jehoshaphat and his people assembled to bless Jehovah after the overthrow of the hosts of the Moabites
